slides.title: Festivals of India
slides.content:
**Major Festivals:**
- Diwali: Festival of Lights
- Holi: Festival of Colors
- Eid-ul-Fitr: Islamic festival
- Christmas: Christian festival
- Dussehra: Victory of good over evil
- Raksha Bandhan: Brother-sister bond
- Pongal, Onam, Baisakhi: Regional festivals

slides.title: Arts & Dance Forms
slides.content:
**Classical Dances:**
- Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu)
- Kathak (North India)
- Kathakali (Kerala)
- Odissi (Odisha)
- Kuchipudi (Andhra Pradesh)
- Manipuri (Manipur)
- Mohiniyattam (Kerala)
- Sattriya (Assam)

slides.title: Languages & Heritage
slides.content:
**Languages:**
- 22 Scheduled languages
- Hindi: Official language
- English: Associate official language

**UNESCO World Heritage Sites:**
- Taj Mahal (Agra)
- Qutub Minar (Delhi)
- Red Fort (Delhi)
- Ajanta & Ellora Caves
- Hampi monuments
- Khajuraho temples

question.questionText: Which classical dance form originated in Tamil Nadu?
question.explanation: Bharatanatyam is a classical dance form that originated in Tamil Nadu. It is one of the oldest dance forms in India.
